caption: One of my favorite place to go for food. They have a big selection always.the staff is great as well. I’ve been to several places for food but nothing can beat their freshness.

This was really interesting, lots of flavor. It was packed with chili pepper and cumin but the noodles and veggies really balanced it out. The second thing I ordered was the soup. This was their beef pano soup. It was a bit more mild than the pulled pork dish but very soothing. They somehow managed to get the bread pieces in the soup, chewy but not soggy. Very delicious food in Lincoln Park.

Such a gem. Flavors in the noodle dishes I couldn't even dream of. Staff has always been nice and accommodating. I always recommend this place to as many people as I can -- I've never had anything like it. I would say go for more of the brothy / noodle dishes vs the apps, but everything is soo good!

Chinese food before, I highly recommend it! The bowls and dumplings here are fantastic, as is anything with pulled pork. The spicy sauces they use are really what makes this place special. I've been to similar restaurants in Chicago Chinatown before -- this is better!

I was in the area so I thought I would stop by for lunch and was really impressed! This first thing I ordered was the Xian Style Noodles with pulled pork. This was really interesting, lots of flavor. It was packed with chili pepper and cumin but the noodles and veggies really balanced it out. The second thing I ordered was the soup. This was their beef pano soup. It was a bit more mild than the pulled pork dish but very soothing. They somehow managed to get the bread pieces in the soup, chewy but not soggy. Very delicious food in Lincoln Park.

Good cold rice noodle and stone pot soup. Spicy and flavorful. Pour out the oil if it’s too much for you. Very good taste of northern Chinese cuisine. Try some before the fake second wave arrives lol.
Love love love the food!
Unique menu, delicious food. Highly recommend!
Taste the same as the dishes in China
(Translated by Google) The meat is too crumbled and rotten... the taste is not enough...  (Original) 肉夹馍那个肉太碎太烂了…味道也不够…

This restaurant is surely one of the most attractive place to eat in the region. Anytime I go there I am exceedingly pleased. They maintain their high  level service and the highest level of dishes  they serve. You will be always satisfied with this place. Warmly  recommended.
I constantly stop buying some food here. I like the rapid customer service and well cooked food. Great work.

(Translated by Google) I just posted a review that didn't seem to show up. Praise the township party, came to Chicago to find a Shaanxi rice, and the menu came here decisively, very authentic, noodles, and sighed in a hurry, forget about garlic. Celery tofu glutinous rice dumplings and bean sprouts gluten ha ha next time. Talk to the boss in Shaanxi, the township party Xi'an, self-taught in Xi'an. I have eaten such a bowl of noodles more than half a year since I came to the United States. I thought of the phrase "noodles are the soul of our Shaanxi people, and we can't give up wherever we go". Besides, Sincerely recommend to all Americans who want to have real xi’an food.  (Original) 刚发了一条review好像没显示。给乡党个好评，来chicago想找个陕西饭，一看菜单果断来这了，很正宗，面美，一口气咥完了，蒜都忘了要了。西芹腐竹👍下次去吃饺子和豆芽面筋哈哈。跟老板陕西话聊，乡党西安人，在西安自学手艺。来美国半年多吃上这么一碗面想起一句话“面是咱陕西人的魂，走到哪里都不能割舍的”Besides,Sincerely recommend to all Americans who want to have real xi’an food.
Authentic Xi'an noodles here

Have been here a few times now and love it every time.  My go to is the pulled pork noodles, it's comforting and so flavorful! I'd recommend trying just about anything. The food is always consistent and the staff here is very professional and polite.

Went here for quock bite with wifey and newborn. Super friendly staff. Nice atmosphere. Super clean. Server was wonderful; so polite and fast. Food was great! Got scallion dumplings, dumplings and pork sandwich. All came out quick, fresh and hot. Will be back!

We got the stone pot noodles, the dumplings, and the combination platter. All were excellent. I got the wide noodles in the stone pot, which I would not get again because they were hard to eat. I would get it with the ramen. Three dishes was too much food for two people, but we took it home.
Amazing food and very friendly staff. The pulled pork is great
Really great place!  Glad we found it, will be going back for sure.

The place is very clean and bright with visually interesting decorations. The food is authentic and full of amazing flavors sold at very reasonable prices. And the people are so friendly! I usually don't bother to write reviews but what really seemed special about this restaurant was the people working there. It was lovely to see how the receptionist greeted me—he beamed a huge, genuine, welcoming smile and waved at me from a distance. You only get to see that kind of "I'm so happy to see you" smile on the face of an old friend, but he just seems to have that kind of friendly personality. And it was heart-warming to see how the receptionist, waiter/owner and waitress, and the cooks interacted with each other, like a family. I can feel their passion for their small business. I always like people who are passionate about what they do, so I decided to write a review to root for them. And of course, what matters, after all, is the quality of the food. Today was my second visit. A friend who grew up in Xi'an brought me over on my first visit and mentioned that this restaurant had the most authentic and delicious Xi'an food in Chicago in his opinion. I've been to Xi'an in the past and have tried all three Xi'an restaurants in Chicago. I agree. The food is outstanding. Combination Noodles and Cold Rice Noodle are outstanding—the former is heavier, and the later is lighter, so I'd recommend starting from the lighter one if you decide to order both. The Beef Paomo is also very delicious (and they have sweet garlic to go with it). The Pork Burger (rou jia mo) is the only one I found underwhelming because the meat is a bit too lean/dry to my taste and is missing green pepper (okay, I welcome debate on whether having green pepper in rou jia mo is authentic or not; I think it's more flavorful). I remember last time I had the ground beef pancake (shao bing) which was crazily delicious. Sad it seemed like it was sold out on my second visit. And oh, it's an open kitchen so you get to see how they prepare the food. The food was served very quickly because there weren't that many tables. I both wish they can get more customers on a Sunday evening (because they deserve it) and also selfishly wonder whether I'd be able to get a table and fast service if everyone comes here. :)
Delicious!
It was ok.  Service seemed a little rushed.  They didnt have some of the popular Xian dishes...such as mutton soup and cows hoofs.  But it was a couple time a year kind of place
Delicious food
so tasty. at first I thought the noodles tasted a little bland, but then the spice kicked in and I couldn’t stop eating them. great service, too.

Awesome addition to Lincoln Park. Craving Northern Chinese cuisine but don't necessarily feel like driving all the way down to Chinatown? Xi'an Dynasty got you covered.  On a previous visit, we had tried the Xian Style Crepe w/ beef, the combination noodles, and the hot and sour dumpling soup. I think the only thing I could kinda complain about was the the beef in the crepe was a tad bit over cooked, but aside from that the food flavors and taste were great. Loved the noodles and the dumplings. Price point won't break the wallet. Seating is just a handful of tables (mostly 2 or 4 seaters). Service is quick and no fuss. Easy street parking ($2/hr).  I see many future visits here in the future when I'm too lazy to drive down to Chinatown. I dig it for the noodles and dumpling soup. Why you still here? Go, go, go.  'Til next time!
Food is very tasty and cheap! My favorite are the Stone Pot Soup, Cold Rice Noodle and Handmade Crepes
Very delicious!
So good, thank you!
Tastes so good. I really like this restaurant

We went in with very high expectations based on all the other reviews. It was somewhat disappointing, as all the dishes were quite salty and the flavors pretty dull. Good food if you're hung over; I'd look for something else if you're looking for flavor.
The best Xi’an food restaurant in Lincoln Park!
'Xi'an is a favorite of our entire family! The menu is pretty small but everything is excellent. We are regulars there.
Xian food is amazing! I miss the wrap when I went to Cian and this place brought me back. It was amazingly delicious.
The food is just OK if you are looking for authentic Xi An food. The tastes are too similar for many dishes.
Amazing food and atmosphere.
(Translated by Google) Cool skin can, other general  (Original) 凉皮可以，其他一般
This place is a hidden gem. They don't have a huge menu, but the food they have is incredibly good and cheap
Authentic Xi’an food.
Best noodle we had in Chicago!
five stars!!!! The only complaint that I have is they should prepare more beef soup. It’s always sold out every time I ordered.😆😆

Hands down the best Xian Chinese food in Chicago!! My family is from Xian and this is the authentic stuff. Flavors were spot on, everything delicious. I nearly cried when I had the beef soup! Short and well curated menu in English with pictures of all the food. Modern and cute dining room, friendly servers, reasonable prices ,large portions, quantity ingredients.  Great non-intimidating introduction to Xian cuisine for newbies and a true taste of home for us Xian folk. My new favorite restaurant in Chicago!!
Authentic and flavorful Xi An street food...dumplings and wonton are very savory tasting
Authentic and surely the best Xi’An taste in town!
(Translated by Google) Recommended meat folder, more authentic, cool skin is very general, taste is not like cool skin like powder and small size  (Original) 推荐肉夹馍，比较正宗了，凉皮很一般，口感不像凉皮像粉皮且份量小

I recently found out this place opened and it wasn't too far from my apartment so I decided to check it out with a friend on a cold night. First, service was fast and friendly. Second the menu was fairly small but that's okay because they can focus on the quality. Xi'an cuisine comes from Northern China where they use more lamb, mutton, beef and pork. This region of China has a heavy emphasis more bread and noodles instead of rice. We got the pork burger, hot and spicy wonton soup, and combination noodles with pulled pork. Everything was really good, I definitely recommend coming with friends and sharing.
The best food I’ve ever had in Chicago!
(Translated by Google) The best Xi'an cuisine in Chicago  (Original) 芝加哥最好吃的西安美食

This place has great western and northern Chinese bites. I wasn’t sure what to expect first time there. The place is setup like a quick turnaround eatery that resembles a Chipotle-ish environment, except they do have table service. Food came quickly and the staff were very friendly. It was not crowded at 6pm on a warm winter Thursday night but did get quite some traffic around 6:30-7pm. We were too deeply concentrated on the delicious veggie crepes and spicy dumplings, pork filled bun and beef brisket soup to take any pictures. One advice- make sure you eat the beef brisket soup right away as the bun cubes tend to soak everything up if you don’t. Enjoy!
I was expecting a big meal but turned out to more like a snack food. But it was supervising good. I wish they open another one in Schaumburg. Recommended.
(Translated by Google) Signboard and pancake fruit are delicious!  (Original) 招牌面和煎饼果子都很好吃！
(Translated by Google) The authentic Xi'an cuisine!  (Original) 道地的西安美食！
(Translated by Google) Very much, will come again!  (Original) 非常道地，會再來享用!
(Translated by Google) very delicious!  (Original) 很美味！
I can see a star restaurant is RISING... Don’t feel surprised to see it on newspapers or cuisine selections in the future. Really authentic Xi’an food, one of the most popular Chinese cuisine.

I just back home after working, stomach feels need something, husband suggested to try some “beef poamo “, he took out from grand opening Chinese restaurant located at LP, the restaurant name is Xian Dynasty Cuisine. I can’t believe that the food is so delicious. I can’t stop until them all gone. I decided to try something else this weekend in person at the restaurant, I 100% trust my “stomach “ will be very happy.

This was a very tasty meal! I had the pulled pork noodles, and the beef pancake! I like my noodles spicy so I asked them for hotter than regular, and boy was it a good call! The noodles came out steaming and were covered in a light, but very rich broth.  The heat crept up on me during the bowl, but it was perfect for me.  The beef pancake was flaky and filled with a tasty meat and onion mixture which went amazingly well with the noodles.  I don't know if it was poor etiquette to scoop up the last of the broth in the bottom of the bowl, but it was better than licking it clean! I'll definitely be back to this friendly and delicious spot.
